subject: Re: [junit] Constructor called multiple times?
msgSnippet: ... 1. setUp() reveals intent better, both on its own and as a counterpart to tearDown() 2. set up code in setUp() means JUnit reserves the right to pool
messageBody:
Adrian Parker wrote:

> What is the distinction between setup() and the constructor? They
> both seem to provide the same functionality (they are both called anew
> before every test method)?

1. setUp() reveals intent better, both on its own and as a counterpart
to tearDown()

2. set up code in setUp() means JUnit reserves the right to pool
instances of test case classes if that should ever become useful
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca

JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
